post_text:
When school began for Aldine ISD students, on August 17, teachers and staff from all 82 schools in Aldine made visits to neighborhoods throughout the district.

"They couldn't come to us, but we could go out to them,‚Äù Maleita Baskin, Jones Elementary School counselor said.

To show you how Aldine ISD is going the extra mile watch how Jones Elementary School and Hoffman Middle School staff is staying connected with their students.

Whether we are together in-person in a classroom, or together virtually, at home or six feet apart, we are #AldineAnywhere

post_text: Listen to Aldine ISD Superintendent Dr. LaTonya Goffney as she recounts the District adopting a new early literacy curriculum. Hear how Aldine ISD analyzed student data and experiences, and developed a district-wide set of beliefs and expectations. #AldineAnywhere
shared_text:
Amplify Education
September 9 at 6:12 PM ¬∑

Join Dr. LaTonya Goffney, Superintendent of Schools for Aldine ISD in Texas, as she recounts her two-year journey with her team of district educators to adopt a new early literacy curriculum. Hear how they successfully challenged the traditional adoption process, studied the science of teaching reading, analyzed student data and experiences, and developed a district-wide set of beliefs and expectations. https://amplify.com/science-of-reading-the-podcast/

post_text: On Friday, Aug. 21 and Saturday, Aug. 24, Aldine ISD delivered more than 1,700 devices to Aldine ISD families to provide them with a laptop during the virtual learning period. WEATHER UPDATE (8/25) Please be advised that Aldine ISD schools and buildings will be closed Aug. 26-28, due to inclement weather connected to Hurricane Laura. The district will not hold any virtual classes or activities and curbside meal distribution has been canceled. Students will not be required to log into Schoology Wednesday-Friday for attendance purposes; however, students may log in to complete classwork that was previously assigned.

post_text:
This week Aldine ISD has received both national and local news coverage. Superintendent Dr. LaTonya Goffney will be featured on MSNBC Live with Stephanie Ruhle during the 8 a.m. morning news show on Fri. July 17. Dr. Goffney will discuss district Return to Learn plans, prioritizing the safety of staff and students and ensuring all students have access to learn at home in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic.

"We will reopen our physical buildings as fast as we can but as slow as we must, all while continuing to provide choices and opportunities for our students." - Dr. LaTonya Goffney

#WeAreAldine

3 Reasons to Register your child for Prekindergarten and Kindergarten:

1. Quality primary school programs give students a leg up on math, literacy and their future.

2. Research shows that children who attend public primary school programs are better prepared for higher levels than children who don‚Äôt.

3. Studies show that the benefits of primary school may extend far beyond academics. Early childhood education brings long-term gains in high school, college graduation, and employment.

Register your child for Aldine ISD Primary School program TODAY: http://ow.ly/snPU50A5yxT #WeAreAldine

post_text: Monday, June 15, kicked off the second round of intense planning meetings surrounding re-entry plans for the school district‚Äôs return to school for the 2020-2021 school year. It follows a week-long exercise held on May 18-22, where more than 30 district and campus leaders met to review the district‚Äôs Core Belief statements and narrow down ideas, themes, and workflow around the needs required for students to return to school, following a nearly four-month break due to COVID-19. The district plans to announce re-entry plans in early July publicly. Read more about the planning: http://ow.ly/Fga950A8y6C

post_text: Aldine ISD Superintendent Dr. LaTonya M. Goffney joins a panel of local superintendents and CEOs to share how Aldine ISD has adapted to new ways of teaching during COVID-19. The panel will also discuss needs that are still prevalent during this unprecedented time. Watch on theTeach for America - Houston Facebook page or watch on Instagram @tfahouston TONIGHT at 6PM. #WeAreAldine
shared_text:
Teach For America - Houston is with Anastasia Lindo Anderson and 2 others.
June 3 at 8:00 PM ¬∑

If you were wondering how education has shifted since this pandemic has caused schools to close, join us here at Teach For America - Houston tomorrow, June 4th at 6pm CST, as we hear from local superintendents and charter CEOs - Sehba Ali (KIPP Texas), Mark DiBella (YES Prep), Dr. Anastasia Lindo-Anderson (Promise Community Schools), Dr. Grenita Lathan (Houston ISD), and Dr. LaTonya Goffney (Aldine ISD) share how their districts have reacted to COVID and virtual learning.

We are beginning to look at possible options to reopen schools for the 2020-2021school year. Before moving forward with any decision or plan, the district wants input from you. Your feedback is critical to the decision-making process for the start of the school year, which is currently scheduled for August 17.

Families can complete a short online questionnaire about how they intend for their students to access school this fall. Complete the SURVEY by Tuesday, June 2: http://ow.ly/GRfB50zRHvz

The program is available to kids 12 and under, every weekday from 11 a.m. to noon. The offer is available at the drive-thru only, and no purchase is necessary.

post_text:
Pre-enrollment is open for eligible students entering prekindergarten and new kindergarten students entering Aldine ISD for the first time. Prekindergarten students currently enrolled in AISD do not need to participate in the pre-enrollment process to enter kindergarten. Documents for your prekindergarten or kindergarten student are available online.

Three-Step Process to Enroll

Step 1: Go to http://ow.ly/JM9K50zQkZ6 to begin the process by
completing the online pre-enrollment documents.

Step 2: Once schools resume, staff will call you to set up an
appointment.

Step 3: Complete the enrollment process by attending the
appointment set by your child's school.
Preregistration runs now until June 30.

post_text: On #MemorialDay we celebrate, honor, and remember the brave men and women who have laid down their lives for our freedom. Due to the holiday, the curbside meal service will not be available for pickup on Monday, May 25. If you have questions related to at-home learning, teachers will resume work on Tuesday, May 26, and the regular curbside meal schedule will resume on Thursday, May 28. #WeAreAldine

post_text:
The Aldine ISD Board of Trustees will hold their May board meeting on Tuesday, May 19 at 7 p.m. The meeting will be held in the Board Room of the Donaldson Administration Building.

The meeting is being held in accordance with the modified Open Meetings Act by order of Governor Greg Abbott on March 16, 2020 suspending certain meeting requirements. These modifications are necessary to promote the health and safety of the Aldine ISD community, and to comply with governmental orders limiting gatherings to 10 or less individuals, as well as guidance from health authorities.

Aldine stakeholders may view the meeting via this link: https://stream.lifesizecloud.com/extension/136009/533fe467-18b2-47d1-8b38-f83b0bdb45ca

Today Facebook is celebrating the Class of 2020! Facebook will broadcast #Graduation2020: Facebook and Instagram Celebrate the Class of 2020. The virtual commencement address will be given by Oprah Winfrey. Awkwafina, Jennifer Garner, Lil Nas X, Simone Biles, and more, will share words of wisdom for the class of 2020.

The virtual graduation hub ‚Äì classof2020.fb.com ‚Äì will offer up ways to celebrate graduates, like hosting a virtual graduation ceremony on Facebook Live.

The streaming event will be available on Facebook Watch and facebook.com/facebookapp. Highlights and more will be posted to the @instagram account on Instagram, plus on contributors‚Äô social media accounts. We encourage our Aldine ISD Class of 2020 students and families to join in on the fun!

post_text:
Aldine ISD has created a Crisis Preparedness Survey. This survey is an opportunity to give confidential feedback on our district, your children‚Äôs schools, and their education.

The survey‚Äôs questions address the overall satisfaction with Aldine‚Äôs response to the COVID-19 pandemic, district and school communication and support, technology access and resources, distance learning, and student support. Results will help the district identify its strengths and develop a targeted action plan for the future. Read More: https://bit.ly/3dJ1Csd

Take it in English or Spanish. Check your email for an invitation to complete the survey or follow the link below: https://bit.ly/2WT3qrJ

post_text: Aldine ISD has served as an educational institution for more than 80 years in North Harris County. Without a doubt, members of the Aldine community have had to explain who, what and where Aldine is and to help with this effort, the ninth-largest school district in the state of Texas hopes to answer these questions by planting its flag confidently around the city of Houston via a billboard campaign. Learn more about our #BetterTogether campaign: http://ow.ly/OYU350zEn4y #WeAreAldine

post_text:
U.S. Congresswoman Sheila Jackson Lee, along with Aldine ISD Superintendent Dr. LaTonya M. Goffney, announced the opening of the first coronavirus drive-through testing location in the Greenspoint on Friday, May 1.

The drive-through testing site is located at Merlin D. Griggs Primary School, located at 801 Regional Park.

The testing is free and is being conducted by United Memorial Medical Center (UMMC) and will take place from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Monday through Friday.

Learn more: http://ow.ly/ihJN50zxion

Ray Mondragon is the new Executive Director of Early Childhood Learning. Mondragon has 19 years of experience in the field of public education, with 16 of those years specific to early childhood education and, most recently, as vice president of programs at the Collaborative for Children in Houston.

As the Executive Director of Early Childhood Learning in Aldine, he will lead all change efforts to increase access to quality programs for the district‚Äôs youngest students. This includes collaborating with partners and community organizations to create more opportunities for students. Read More: http://ow.ly/JFhH50zltPA

post_text:
Aldine ISD families don‚Äôt forget to tune into My20-Houston today, 11a.m. to Noon, for our Aldine ISD Classes at Home programming. Each Tuesday Aldine ISD will receive an hour of programming on My 20. The hour-long program will feature art, reading, writing, math and provide information for parents and students on art projects they can do at home as a family.

Additionally, a 5-minute Social Emotional Learning segment will air at the end of the program. Please check your local cable operator for channel location. #WeAreAldine #AldineAtHome

post_text:
Aldine ISD will begin distributing electronic devices to students in Grades 6-12 beginning the week of April 13. A limited supply of Chromebooks and WiFi hotspots will be available for these students. Available quantities are limited to one device per family.

Devices for Aldine ISD Seniors can be requested here: https://bit.ly/2XcL7j5

Devices for Aldine ISD Students in grades 6-11 can be requested here: https://bit.ly/3dI5Hxv

Registration forms will open at 5:00 p.m. on Monday, April 6 and Close at Noon on Thursday, April 9.

We have also compiled a list of FREE WiFi and low-cost Internet resources from local internet and cable providers: https://bit.ly/2UNnYCf

Devices for Aldine ISD Students in grades 6-11 can be requested here: https://bit.ly/3dI5Hxv

We hope you enjoyed our Aldine ISD at Home programming today. Each Tuesday Aldine ISD will receive an hour of programming on My 20. The hour-long program will feature art classes and provide information for parents and students on art projects they can do at home as a family.

Additionally, a 5-minute Social Emotional Learning segment will air at the end of the program. Please check your local cable operator for channel location. #WeAreAldine #AldineAtHome

post_text:
Aldine ISD schools will remain closed and students will remain at home, receiving online learning and enrichment activities until further notice.

Aldine ISD will also continue providing breakfast and lunch pick-up. All planned events, field trips, and activities are officially canceled. Some events will be rescheduled or held virtually.

To ensure you have the most recent updates related to the district's plans, preparations and up-to-date health information impacting our community please continue to visit www.aldineisd.org/healthalerts. #WeAreAldine #AldineAtHome #AldineCares

post_text:
Aldine ISD Parents and Legal Guardians:

To keep you up-to-date with the latest district news about COVID-19, we need your current contact information. Here are three ways to update your contact information:

1. If you have a Home Access Center Account (HAC), please go to HAC and ensure your contact information, phone, and email, are up-to-date.

2. If you do not have a HAC account, please register today by going to AldineISD.org/HAC. If you need assistance, please contact HomeAccessCenter@aldineisd.org

3. Learn more at AldineISD.org/HAC.

#WeAreAldine

Familias, actualicen su informaci√≥n de contacto: https://bit.ly/2Um79yd
text:
Aldine ISD Parents and Legal Guardians:

To keep you up-to-date with the latest district news about COVID-19, we need your current contact information. Here are three ways to update your contact information:

1. If you have a Home Access Center Account (HAC), please go to HAC and ensure your contact information, phone, and email, are up-to-date.

2. If you do not have a HAC account, please register today by going to AldineISD.org/HAC. If you need assistance, please contact HomeAccessCenter@aldineisd.org

3. Learn more at AldineISD.org/HAC.

#WeAreAldine

Familias, actualicen su informaci√≥n de contacto: https://bit.ly/2Um79yd

post_text:
Aldine ISD leaders, government officials and community leaders are encouraging all Harris County residents to participate in the 2020 Census. Census data is used to determine how to distribute millions of dollars in federal funding, grants, programming and support to our schools. Our goal for the 2020 Census is to make sure that everyone in Aldine ISD counted. Read More: http://ow.ly/YInf50yURX3 #WeAreAldine #YesToCensus2020

Aldine ISD has partnered with the Houston Food Bank to help local families in need during this time. We are hosting a drive-thru food pickup from 9 a.m. to Noon on Friday, March 27, at M.O. Campbell, 1865 Aldine Bender Road. The service will be provided on a first-come, first-served basis and there is a limit of one bag per family. The goal is to feed about 700-900 people. Learn More: http://ow.ly/uOXy50yVu2R #WeAreAldine

Harris County Department of Education is hosting a virtual panel for educators and families from 10 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. on Tuesday. March 24. Join Aldine ISD Director of Internal Communications, Leticia Fehling and Hall Center for Education principal, Marcie Strahan as they discuss strategies and tools to help families stay calm during uncertain times.

You can join the meeting from your computer, tablet or smartphone: https://global.gotomeeting.com/join/806266821

You can also dial in using your phone. +1 (872) 240-3311 Access Code: 806-266-821

post_text:
Houston Public Media is taking action to help ensure learning continues in homes through grade-level appropriate educational programming for elementary, middle and high school students, and accompanying free, learn-at-home digital resources.

Starting today, they will provide distance learning instruction and multiplatform resources that tie into required school courses, such as math, science and history.

The expanded programming begins on Houston Public Media TV 8 on Monday, March 23:

6:00 ‚Äì 8:00 am ‚Äì Elementary School: Curriculum programming focused on pre-kindergarten ‚Äì 3rd grade students

8:00 am ‚Äì 1:00 pm ‚Äì Middle School: Curriculum programming focused on 4th grade ‚Äì 8th grade students

1:00 ‚Äì 6:00 pm ‚Äì High School: Curriculum programming focused on 9th grade ‚Äì 12th grade students

You can find the new broadcast schedule and more information on the vast library of PBS content accessible to you across various platforms here: https://bit.ly/3bkHJ9C

#AldineAtHome #WeAreAldine

post_text:
Calling ALL Aldine ISD students! Get inspired this weekend and create art! Show us your art skills through 2D, 3D or photography. Use the hashtag #AldineArt on Twitter, Instagram and Facebook to share your artwork with us. This week's element: LINE. Check out the graphic for more instructions.

Comment on this post with your art entry, please include your name, grade, and school so we can celebrate you. The winner will be chosen on Fridays and showcased on our social media pages.
Participants must be an Aldine student and all entries will be judged by Aldine Art Teachers.

#WeAreAldine #AldineAtHome #AldineArt

post_text:
Aldine ISD Child Nutrition Services will be providing FREE meals for Aldine ISD student March 16-20 and March 23. Child Nutrition staff will offer Grab and Go breakfast and a hot lunch via curbside service at select campuses. Students 18 and under must be present to receive meals. Breakfast will be served from 7:30 to 9 a.m. and lunch will be served 11:30 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. Meals will be located at the front of each school.

At this time we are not accepting volunteers to assist with our curbside meal service. Out of an abundance of caution, we are encouraging social distancing to prevent the likelihood of members of our Aldine community falling ill during this time. ‚ÄúSocial distancing‚Äù is a term that epidemiologists are using to refer to a conscious effort to reduce close contact between people and hopefully stymie community transmission of the virus.

Read More: https://bit.ly/38O26uc

#WeAreAldine

post_text: Today we honored our 2019-2020 Educators of the Year! We rounded up our district Principals and Teachers of the Year for a Boots and Bling themed Educators of the Year breakfast. During the event we honored all 82 campus teachers of the year, 2 principals of the year, 1 rookie principal of the year, 2 rookie teachers of the year and 6 teacher of the year finalist. At the end of the event Carter Academy art teacher, Ms. Yvonne Lopez-Taylor was named the 2019-2020 Elementary Teacher of the Year and Davis Senior High School history teacher, Dawn Brimhall, was named 2019-2020 Secondary Teacher of the Year. Congratulations to all of our Educator of the Year Honorees.

How do teachers prepare the next generation?

By teaching more than just academics. According to Latrice Sumuel, teachers can inspire, give students a voice, make them feel heard and build their self worth. ‚ÄúThis can happen when we teach history and music‚Äîand when we have authentic conversations that lead to the wow factor.‚Äù

Want more #teacherinspo? Read teacher profiles like Latrice‚Äôs and learn about the #BlackTeacherTalk Twitter chat on February 26. #BlackHistoryMonth https://ontch.org/2H7M9nr

Principals Sandra Doria, Jeana Morrison-Adams and Aisley Adams were shocked after learning they were named Principals of the Year. The three principals were surprised on their campus by Superintendent Dr. LaTonya M. Goffney and District leadership staff on Feb. 18.

Sandra Doria (Worsham Elementary School) was named Elementary Principal of the Year.

Jeana Morrison-Adams (Hoffman Middle School) was named Secondary Principal of the Year.

Aisley Adams (Nimitz Ninth Grade School) was named Rookie Principal of the Year.

Read more about our principals of the year: https://bit.ly/2uckEpL

post_text:
MacArthur Senior High School junior, Asiria Martinez, is a second-year recipient of the Aldine Education Foundation Scholar award.

Each year, Aldine Education Foundation offers all Aldine ISD high school students the opportunity to become a Foundation Scholar recipient. Students must receive a final grade of 95 in all classes to receive this honor. The award grows each year the student earns the distinction.

The first year, a student earns $250 in scholarship money. If a student performs at this level all four years of high school, they will receive a total of $3,000 in Foundation Scholar Awards. Learn more: https://bit.ly/2SFOQSu

post_text: Every month, Aldine ISD principals and district leaders meet to collaborate, learn how to become better leaders, and celebrate accomplishments across the district. At this month's Instructional Leadership Meeting on February 6, several principals were recognized for improvements in attendance. The Aldine AFT awarded gift certificates to Lewis Middle School principal Tonya Clark-Antwine and Caraway Elementary principal Everette Taylor to purchase additional school supplies.

This week is #NationalCounselorsWeek. We celebrated our district counselors on Thursday, February 7.

Superintendent Dr. LaTonya M. Goffney, alongside other members of Aldine's leadership team, assembled as many of our counselors as possible to express their sincerest gratitude to the unsung heroes of education. Happy National Counselors Week to all of our counselors! Thank you for your dedication to help Aldine ISD students live their dreams. #WeAreAldine

post_text: Aldine ISD hosted the 61st annual Livestock Show and Auction on January 31 at the M.O. Campbell Educational Center (MOC). FFA students and their livestock animals filled the floor of the MOC arena. The event included elementary and middle schools tours, an art exhibit, a FFA science fair, a buyers‚Äô dinner, and a live auction. The Sale of Champions produced $202,0771 in sales. The Aldine Education Foundation Sports Spectacular raised more than $20,000 for AEF programs that support our students and educators. The event featuring the Harlem Wizards and the Aldine All-Stars brought out more than 1,000 guests.

The event was underwritten in part by Title Sponsor Aldine Noon Optimist Club. Texas Children‚Äôs Health Plan sponsored a $2,500 scholarship and Precinct 1 Constable Alan Rosen added to the winnings by donating a $1,000 scholarship.

The community event was a SLAM DUNK for all of Aldine ISD! #WeAreAldine

Each year, high school students from across the district have an opportunity to create western artwork for the Houston Livestock Show and Rodeo and the Aldine ISD FFA exhibition. Students submit their artwork for the FFA art contest and the artwork is then judged by professional artists. The top six art pieces are selected to be sold during the live auction at the Buyer‚Äôs Dinner at 5 p.m. on Friday, January 31. Congratulations to the 2020 FFA Visual Art Winners!

1 Dolce Torres, MacArthur HS
2 Daniela Ventura, Blanson CTE HS
3 Montserrat Mireles, MacArthur HS
4 Kimberly Hernandez, Nimitz HS
5 Yazmin Vazquez, Aldine HS
6 Christina Duong, Eisenhower HS

Read More: https://bit.ly/37BvnIU
#WeAreAldine

shared_text:
Aldine ISD added 17 new photos.
January 27 at 11:55 PM ¬∑

Aldine ISD Superintendent Dr. LaTonya M. Goffney delivered her second annual State of the District address on Wednesday, Jan. 15 to more than 250 invited guests gathered for the event. Among those present for the event were local faith leaders, elected officials, and community and business partners.

Goffney‚Äôs presentation focused on the district‚Äôs ongoing efforts to fulfill promises made in its strategic plan, A New Way Forward. The superintendent also outlined future goals, as well as inviting everyone in the room to form or expand partnerships to create more choices and opportunities for students.

Visit our State of the District website for more information on both current and new programs for students in Aldine ISD. #WeAreAldine https://www.aldineisd.org/state-of-the-district/

post_text: The Aldine ISD Orff Ensemble has been selected to perform at the Texas Music Educators Association (TMEA) annual convention in San Antonio. The ensemble includes students in Grades 3-5 from 40 schools across the district. Read More: http://ow.ly/ArqV50y64Q0

post_text: Aldine ISD and Carver High School are mourning Michael ‚ÄúMr. Mac‚Äù McCullough, the Carver High band instructor, who passed away unexpectedly. He was a fixture in the Aldine ISD performing arts community and devoted 24 years to sharing his love of music with students. Read more about the impact "Mr. Mac" had on the Aldine ISD community. http://ow.ly/IZVk50y61N8

post_text:
Dental students from the Greater Houston Dental Hygienists' Association are providing FREE dental services for Kids ages 5-18 from 8 a.m. to Noon on Feb. 1, at Blanson CTE High School. Email ghdhscommunity@gmail.com to schedule an appointment.

Update: Free appointments are now open for adults. Schedule an appointment today for FREE oral screenings and sealants.

post_text: The 61st annual Aldine ISD Livestock Show will be held Jan. 30-31 at the M.O. Campbell Educational Center, 1865 Aldine Bender Road. The annual event showcases Aldine ISD high school student livestock market projects, showmanship skills, and rodeo art. Visit the livestock show website for more information. http://ow.ly/Q4gR50y4pDm

post_text: Aldine ISD is hosting the 15-6A Swim Meet. A varsity meet was held on January 23 and the sub-varsity meet will be held today at 4:30 p.m. The meet is at Davis High School, 1252 Ella Blvd.

post_text: Thank you to everyone who was able to join us to support Aldine ISD scholars at the Aldine Education Foundation Sports Spectacular basketball game, featuring the Harlem Wizards and the Aldine All-Stars. Congratulations to Naomi Mays, Aldine High School junior who won a $2,500 scholarship sponsored by Texas Children's Health Plan and Jessica Picaz, MacArthur High School junior, for winning a $1,000 scholarship sponsored by Harris County Precinct One - Office of Constable Alan Rosen. We hope you had a SPECTACULAR time! Enjoy a few photos from the event.

Congratulations to Naomi Mays, Aldine High School junior who won a $2,500 scholarship sponsored by Texas Children's Health Plan and Jessica Picaz, MacArthur High School junior, for winning a $1,000 scholarship sponsored by Harris County Precinct One - Office of Constable Alan Rosen. We hope you had a SPECTACULAR time! Enjoy a few photos from the event.

post_text:
January is School Board Recognition Month. This month we take the time to highlight our elected Board of Trustees and their commitment to Aldine ISD students and the Aldine community. We appreciate their dedication to the students and staff of Aldine ISD.

Our board members are unpaid volunteers who serve our 82 schools and nearly 67,000 students. Join us this month as we continue to celebrate our board for their hard work to ensure each students graduates with choices and opportunities.

If you see a board member, tell them THANK YOU for all they do for Aldine ISD and for #LaunchingTheNextGeneration. #SchoolBoardMonth #WeAreAldine

Read More about the Aldine ISD Board of Trustees: https://bit.ly/2SX5vm9

post_text:
7 Tips to Get Your Kids Reading Over Winter Break:

1. Create a Reading Challenge
2. Visit the public library
3. Explore books with similar subjects
4. Find books/series by authors your child already enjoys
5. Check-out non-fiction books
6. Pack books for road trips and plane rides
7. Make time to read as a family

Aldine ISD is working to give students the best opportunities to read on grade level. Learn more about the Aldine ISD literacy initiative. https://bit.ly/38RDF0g #WeAreAldine

Aldine ISD added 5 new photos.
December 20, 2019 at 6:02 PM ¬∑

Superintendent Dr. LaTonya M. Goffney meets with student representatives from each of the Aldine ISD high schools once a month. The Superintendent's Student Ambassadors are chosen by their principals to represent their high school. Each month, the ambassadors meet with the Superintendent to share ideas or challenges they face at their schools. They are also encouraged to propose new ideas or programs for their schools. This has given students a new way to have a voice in Aldine ISD.

post_text:
In Case You Missed It ... Associate Editor Michele Molnar interviewed Superintendent Dr. LaTonya M. Goffney for her article titled "They Were Named Superintendents of the Year. Here's What They Want From Vendors."

Dr. Goffney demands results from companies' products and proof that they are improving outcomes for all students. Additionally, the partners she most respects are those that build relationships and "know what the problems are, and what issues we're facing."

Read the full article posted in EdWeek Market Brief on Nov. 22: https://bit.ly/34FDItr

post_text:
For this year‚Äôs contest, which will start on January 1, there‚Äôs a lot to talk about. NPR recently updated its rules to incorporate some of the questions and feedback they received from students after year one of the contest.

The most significant change is music. NPR is allowing some forms of music ‚Äì as long as the music is original and doesn‚Äôt break copyright laws. There‚Äôs a lot to unpack. If you have questions about anything, NPR encourages you to send an email to studentpodcastchallenge@npr.org before you submit. Here‚Äôs what the rules say on the contest website: https://n.pr/2Y8eFN8

post_text: Voters in Aldine ISD went to the polls on Tuesday, Nov. 5 and returned incumbents Dr. Kimberley Booker, Dr. Viola M. Garcia and Paul Shanklin to their respective seats on the Aldine ISD Board of Education. Randy Bates was elected to the Position 1 seat. Each of them were sworn in at the monthly November board meeting. Read more: https://bit.ly/35sd9rW

post_text: 21 Aldine ISD juniors were recently selected to participate in the 2021 Aldine ISD EMERGE Fellowship cohort. Students participating in the program will receive SAT preparation, attend college admission and financial aid workshops, receive assistance with college applications, one-on-one mentoring and visit colleges and universities during summer tours. The partnership between EMERGE and Aldine ISD will increase acceptance into some of the top competitive colleges and universities in the United States. Read More: https://bit.ly/2D4N9GV
shared_text:
ALDINEISD.ORG

21 Aldine ISD juniors were recently selected to participate in the 2021 Aldine ISD EMERGE Fellowship cohort. Students participating in the program will receive SAT preparation, attend college admission and financial aid workshops, receive assistance with college applications, one-on-one mentoring and visit colleges and universities during summer tours. The partnership between EMERGE and Aldine ISD will increase acceptance into some of the top competitive colleges and universities in the United States. Read More: https://bit.ly/2D4N9GV

post_text:
Aldine Education Foundation is hosting its first Sports Spectacular for Scholars featuring the Harlem Wizards vs. Aldine All-Stars. Ticket sales will benefit Aldine ISD students and teachers.

The Wizards will tip off against Aldine ISD teachers, coaches, and community leaders to provide a fun-filled evening of basketball hi-jinx for a great cause. The event will take place from 7 to 9 p.m. on Wednesday, January 22, 2020, at M.O. Campbell Educational Center, 1865 Aldine Bender Rd, 77032. Doors will open at 6 p.m.

Tickets are on sale NOW: https://bit.ly/2OmRg6s

#WeAreAldine

post_text:
Join us at our Active Parent University session on Thursday, November 21, from 8:15 a.m. to 10:15 a.m.

The topic will center on healthy habits for healthy families. Speakers include staff from the district‚Äôs Child Nutrition Services Department. They will share information about school meal choices. They will also discuss how to maintain healthy eating habits at home. Representatives from Smile Barn Dental and United Health Partners will also be present to chat about the importance of dental hygiene and overall health.

The event will take place at the Donaldson Child Nutrition Center (1802 Aldine Bender Road ‚Ä¢ Houston, TX 77032).

We look forward to seeing you!

Aldine ISD school buildings will be opening early on Wednesday, Nov. 13 to reduce the amount of time students have to wait outside in the cold weather. Heaters in all buildings will run throughout the night so pipes remain as warm as possible.

Child Nutrition Services will have breakfast prepared early to serve students. #WeAreAldine

post_text: Milk is a nutrient powerhouse. However, the district noticed a drop in milk consumption once chocolate milk was removed. That equated to a substantial loss in the nutrients students received. In the 2018-2019 school year, the district decided to reintroduce low-fat chocolate milk. Aldine ISD saw a 9 percent increase in consumption in comparison to 2017-2018. Read more at https://bit.ly/34FpIzu
shared_text:
ALDINEISD.ORG
AISD Reintroduces Chocolate Milk in Schools, Sees Positive Results
text:
Milk is a nutrient powerhouse. However, the district noticed a drop in milk consumption once chocolate milk was removed. That equated to a substantial loss in the nutrients students received. In the 2018-2019 school year, the district decided to reintroduce low-fat chocolate milk. Aldine ISD saw a 9 percent increase in consumption in comparison to 2017-2018. Read more at https://bit.ly/34FpIzu

ALDINEISD.ORG
AISD Reintroduces Chocolate Milk in Schools, Sees Positive Results

Families and students can learn about the District‚Äôs school options such as magnet, CTE, early college high schools, International Baccalaureate¬Æ program (PreK-12), and additional school choice options. The programs are open to all students that live in Aldine and the surrounding districts.

School Bus Fleet Magazine
October 15, 2019 at 10:46 PM ¬∑

‚ÄúWhen I joined the transportation department, it felt like home,‚Äù says Jill Metcalfe, the executive director of transportation for Aldine ISD. ‚ÄúThe smells were the same as the ones I grew up with in my dad‚Äôs shop. I had a foundation for pupil transportation and fleet management, but it was the people in the department accepting me and training me that ultimately allowed me to be successful.‚Äù

Metcalfe is one of 10 Phenomenal Women in Transportation featured in our upcoming November issue. Read more about her experiences in the industry at the link below.

shared_text:
Aldine ISD added 46 new photos ‚Äî at Aldine ISD.
October 15, 2019 at 4:47 PM ¬∑ Houston, TX ¬∑

Students and staff at schools across the district were not the only ones celebrating Hispanic Heritage Month (September 15-October 15). Aldine‚Äôs district leaders also took part. Aldine ISD believes the pathway to success in college and life begins in our schools. District leaders champion this month as an opportunity to educate our students about Hispanic heritage. The celebratory month is an opportunity to highlight the cultures and traditions of those who trace their routes to Spain, Mexico, and the Spanish-speaking countries within Central America, South America, and the Caribbean.

Follow the Twitter account for your child's school to see how they celebrated.

post_text: Aldine ISD has canceled school and all activities for Friday, Sept. 20, due to inclement weather in the Houston area. All AISD buildings will be closed.
text: Aldine ISD has canceled school and all activities for Friday, Sept. 20, due to inclement weather in the Houston area. All AISD buildings will be closed.

post_text: Due to the rain and road conditions, dismissals and bus transportation will be delayed. As roads are cleared and safe passages are identified, busses will transport students home. Walkers will be released on a case by case scenario. Safety is our top priority. Each campus is stocked with additional supplies and food. Staff members are available to ensure the remaining students are safe and dry.
text: Due to the rain and road conditions, dismissals and bus transportation will be delayed. As roads are cleared and safe passages are identified, busses will transport students home. Walkers will be released on a case by case scenario. Safety is our top priority. Each campus is stocked with additional supplies and food. Staff members are available to ensure the remaining students are safe and dry.

post_text: Aldine ISD has not made a decision about school tomorrow. Our focus is on ensuring students are safe today. We are sheltering in place and we will provide updates if there are any changes that impact schedules or dismissal.

post_text:
BUS DRIVER: Denise Wyatt
LOCATION: West Side Transportation

Denise has been driving school busses for 29 years. She is happy to make sure our Aldine ISD students get to and from school safely each day.

Openings for Bus Drivers are available starting at $17.65/hour.
- Drivers are guaranteed 6.25 hours
- Free childcare
- $1,000 sign-on bonus for full-time drivers with CDL and a $500 sign-on bonus for Non-CDL applicants
- Pre-employment tutorials and CDL training provided

Applicants do not need a CDL to apply for employment with Aldine ISD Transportation. Apply today online or in person. https://bit.ly/2lWkWg3

Tag a friend and invite them to start their career with Aldine ISD.

post_text:
Join Grandparents Raising Grandchildren and Aldine ISD at the 16th Annual Family Strengthening Conference.

The event will take place from 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. on Saturday, September 7 at the M.O. Campbell Educational Center, located at 1865 Aldine Bender Road.

We welcome the entire family to attend! Take advantage of health care screenings, social services, college preparatory, and school supplies. A free lunch will be provided as well as fun activities for children. #grandparentsraisinggrandkids https://bit.ly/2k3GiaF

post_text: Aldine ISD is proud to announce that we have moved from a 'C' rated school district to a ‚ÄòB‚Äô rated school district based on the State of Texas‚Äô academic accountability ratings. The state accountability system grades school districts and school campuses on student achievement, school progress/growth, and closing the achievement gap. We are proud of our academic gains districtwide and look forward to working harder to ensure high-quality learning experiences for all students! #WeAreAldine http://ow.ly/lyeA50vGgSy

post_text: The countdown begins! The first day of school is Tuesday, August 20 for all Aldine ISD students. If you are new to the district please enroll your new student(s) online at www.aldineisd.org/enrollment. Visit www.aldineisd.org for more back-to-school information. #WeAreAldine

post_text: We are officially moving into @AvalosPTECH! Students and staff will soon fill the hallways of the new campus. Avalos offers high school students free workforce certificates, associate degrees, internships and career development. The campus will open this fall.
